name: ClubHotel Riu Negril

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The vacation was fantastic, the hotel was marginal at best. The facilities appeared to be beautiful from appearance. I was very impressed when we first arrived at the resort. However, that quickly came to a halt.
reviews.title: Too bad, could've been a great place, but not worth it

reviews.text: Coming from the Midwest, the first night of a warm room was nice. However, after 3 nights of telling the hotel staff my A/C was not working, I had enough. they literally argued wiht me that it was fine and working properly. The outdoor hallways were cooler than our room. The other couple we were with stayed in a room right next door to us. Their room was easily 15-20 degrees cooler than ours. I finally had to demand to be moved to a new room rather than being offered a new room. This entire process took several hours out of our vacation time talking to maintenance, front desk personnel. The new room was much cooler. Ceiling fans still squeaked, hallways noisy, but at least our room wasn't a sauna.
reviews.title: The Jamaican people make your holiday with there good manners and personality

reviews.text: If you stay at the hotel, hoard any washcloth or towel you can see and hide it. Between our friends and us, we had to make at least 3-4 phone calls per day, and visit the front desk just to get a single washcloth. Several times the front desk would tell us "They are on their way" and nobody would show up. Also, our bed did not have a bedspread. Nice first impression of the room!
reviews.title: Been there, done that, probably won't do again.

reviews.text: To make up for our problems the hotel provided us reservations at their best restaurant Sir Andrews. When we showed up for our 6:30 reservation, they told us they bumped us to a 9:00 reservation. When I asked why they didn’t notify us, they said "We called your room." DUH, I am at the pool or on a beach all day, I am not going to hear my phone ring. No note on door, no phone message left, just a single attempt at a phone call. Customer service was certainly not their specialty.
reviews.title: We had a GREAT time!

reviews.text: Entertainment staff was fantastic. However, appeared to be a bit unorganized at time. Craziness is extremely entertaining!
reviews.title: Won't return to Riu Negril

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a glorious week at the Riu Negril. This was our second visit to the Riu Negril, the first one being in 2005. Believe it or not Negril was not my first vacation choice -but since I found a really good price on airfare from Phila. we deceided on returning to the Riu ,mainly because we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves there last time. {have also been to Iberostar Tucan & Iberostar Del mar both Riviera Maya Mexico. The Majestic and the Grand Oasis both in Punta Cana and Breezes in the Bahamas.
reviews.title: Great time at the Riu Negril-go and enjoy!

reviews.text: As our trip got closer I started getting worried because many of the reviews were not very good.
reviews.title: It wasn't awful, but it wasn't great

reviews.text: As it turned out our trip was fantastic-but Jamaica is Jamaica and if you are looking for the New York Ritz you will be dissappointed.
reviews.title: Not Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For anyone who has not made the 90 minute journey from the Montego Bay airport to Negril-well it IS a reality check for sure.
reviews.title: Would not return

reviews.text: With all that said here goes my review
reviews.title: AMAZING VACATION!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just got home 18/09/11 and I have already booked to go back .. The hotel was amazing, please ignore all negative reviews. Staff could not have been more helpful.. We arrived at the hotel and received excellent service and the quickest check in. Entertainment was amazing day and night, bar staff never kept u waiting and the service u got at meal times was fantastic .. Our Jamaican mumma (rep) was always around and willing to help. The rooms are cleaned daily to an excellent standard and mini bars were stocked every other day and if u wanted it stocked sooner that was no problem... There was always a different variety of food and the jerk chicken on the beach was delish. There's so many excursions to do at great prices and all of them look great .. We done black river, ys falls and duns river and they were all brill .. Every thing about the place was brilliant and I cannot wait to go back.
reviews.title: Have just booked to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since I posted a previous review for this hotel ('good enough to be going back'), I've been back and we found on the whole things have not changed since our first holiday there. The addition of the pool 'parasols' are a welcome addition. We didn't have to go looking for a sun umbrella this year, there was plenty of shade if needed. The food in the main buffet restaurant for evening meal was slightly disappointing this time, we found some nights there was nothing that took our fancy. That's our issue though in that our tastes are different to what was on offer that night. The staff were their usual excellent selves, we were amazed that so many of them recognised us from last year, especially when you think about how many ppeople must stay there from year to year. A bit of respect, a sense of humour and willingness to laugh along goes a long way to being treated as valued customers.
reviews.title: My return experiences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only moan this time is that there were several holidaymakers there who seemed to lack volume control of both their voices and alcohol consumption and that's putting it mildly. It's really not much fun to be in the same pool as someone who is spitting their drink out into the water, someone walking across the pool holding plates of food, sharing the pool bar with several people whose aim is to try to drink the bar dry of everything alcoholic within the day and then watch while drunks stagger about falling everywhere and being sick It stops being funny after five minutes. You might say 'leave the pool then' but why should I? I'm entitled to be there too. I do lay part blame on the hotel here; there should be some sort of curbing behaviour like this when it starts to become offensive and bordering on disgusting, regardless of being all inclusive or not. The hotel also needs to take more action on people smoking 'stuff' other than tobacco. I really don't want to be a passive smoker of illegal drugs thanks very much.
reviews.title: Great will go back

reviews.text: Anyway, despite my petty issues, I was not disappointed this year and would certainly return in the future.
reviews.title: Great Holiday

reviews.text: Have just got back on 19.09.2011. Everything about the hotel was really good, fastest check in ever ,the rooms were cleaned daily and to a very high standard, The food in all the resturants was varied , with a good selection and well cooked and the staff were very friendly. The bar staff were excellent, very friendly and a good laugh and never scared to serve the drinks,the longest i ever waited for a drink was never more than a couple of minutes and usually they'd poured your drink before you'd finished your last , i recommend giving a small tip as we've found over the years it improves the service but it is not required and the service is very good regardless. The entertainment team were very good, always smiling and up for a chat and probably the best dancers i've seen, i must admit i did find at night there was a bit too much dancing but thats just me. Even the reception staff were very friendly which in my experience is a first. The hotel layout is good with accomidation at one end and the bars and disco at the other so you could have it quiet if you want. We found Tony the taxi man outside the front of the hotel very friendly and would recommend him for trips out remember some of the attractions like dunns river falls you don't need a rep with you. Jamaica is a great place with some things i've not seen anywhere else, we did the jungle zip lines which was amazing, rafting down the river which was good, climbing dunns river waterfall which was really good, a boat trip snorkelling and then stopped off at Rick's Cafe to watch the locals diving off the cliffs and if you're up to it you can jump off as well. We went into Negril during the day and night and found the locals to be very friendly but remember to use the same precautions as you would in any unfamiliar place. 7 mile beach is beautiful , the hotel is actually on Bloody Bay which is very nice with trees on the beach for shade,it is next to 7 mile but a taxi isn't expensive or you can call places like Margeritaville and they will pick you up. We had a great time and will definately be going back.
reviews.title: Mostly Good, Some Bad, Nothing Ugly

reviews.text: Just got back from this hotel after a 2 week stay.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Has Few Problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked with First Choice,there service was excellent.
reviews.title: Great Vacation, Great Resort

reviews.text: Flight out excellent,food on plane very good.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived in Montego Bay Airport we were met by the rep and put on a small coach,
reviews.title: On the verge of being good but falls really, really, really short

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the journey to the hotel took about 90minutes,problem was no air conditioning on the coach
reviews.title: Worst trip to Jamaica thanks RIU Negril

reviews.text: We stayed here in 2005 and so far it's been our best all-inclusive vacation. The food was plentiful and the rooms were nearly new at the time. The only thing lacking was the bugs. I'm not sure if they were sand fleas (which I was told) or bed bugs my legs were inflamed after the week was over. (and I never noticed anything biting me). Anyway, great hotel!!
reviews.title: Best all-inclusive vacation

reviews.text: FANTASTIC HOTEL, food, room, staff, beach, drinks excellent holiday!
reviews.title: SUPERB!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly dont read the bad reviews this place is amazing! :)
reviews.title: AMAZING!! Best place ive ever been too :)

reviews.text: Me and my partner stayed here for 2 weeks and had the best time ever! All the staff are freindly and will do anything to make sure you are having a great time. The food is really good, cooked breakfast aswell as fruits and cereals and even doughnuts! Jerk chicken hut at lunchtime it brilliant and there is also a buffet. There is a buffet in the evening with so much too choose from - you wont stop eating, There are also 3 restrants that you have to pre-book but thats no problem the lady is there till bout 3 in the afternoon.
reviews.title: Disapointing riu

reviews.text: The entertainers are amazing they work so hard and are soo funny theyd allways come and sit and chat with you aswell one night they were sat with us and decided to do another show wich was really funny, and this was after they had finished work! Spider man is lovley and really funny :)
reviews.title: Absolutley Fantastic

reviews.text: This was my 2nd trip back to the Riu Negril this year, and we had a blast (again!) We absolutely love the people who work there. Everything about staying here is just so, easy. It seriously is a week full of 'no worries'!
reviews.title: 2nd trip just as fun as the first

reviews.text: I was there between 10/Sep/11 to 24/Sep/11 with my wife and two children 18 and 20 years young adults. We were on a Thomson all inclusive holiday package.
reviews.title: Ravi in Clubhotel Riu Negrill, Jamaica

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The start was bad. When we arrived, we had to wait over two hours by the road side in hot sun for the coach. Shame on you Thomson.
reviews.title: Relax and have fun, it's a vacation!

reviews.text: The Resort was fantastic. Great beach, great restaurants and bars. The hotel has 400+ rooms but was at around 50 percent occupancy. Because it was September, there were very few young children (I saw about 6).
reviews.title: GO NEXT DOOR TO THE RIU PALACE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet restaurant (green Island) was great. Huge range of food, so I was not bored over the two week period. There were two ala carte restaurants Shadows and Sir Andrews where you have to make booking. Shadows was a disappointment. Starter and Sweets was buffet style only the main course was ala carte. They ran out of both starter and sweet when I go there. Sir andrews was better, but they did not have what we wanted for main course on both occasions we were there. Green Island was great, full marks for food and staff were very friendly. Make your regular tips (say 2/3 US$ each time), they reciprocate your kindness with great care and friendliness. They work for 10 US$ per day approx. The tips goes a long way for them.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT - can't wait to go back!
Nice stay, but would probably stay elsewhere.
reviews.text: We had a good time here, but it was nothing over the top. Food was good. Loved the jerk hut on the beach. One big Party. Beach was okay...since it was man made, it smelled like sulfur toward the end...But an nice hike...and you will find lovely beaches and wonderful locals... Property was nice and well taken care of. pOOLS AND SWIM UP BAR NOT THAT GREAT AND WE ARE PARTIERS...TOOK A WHILE TO GET WATERED DOWN DRINKS AT SWIM BAR. Loved Negril and would definitely go back, but would stay somewhere else.

reviews.title: Good value for the money-great staff
reviews.text: Overall the Riu Negril was a good value for the money. Once you get through customs at the Airport (took us over 2 hours) and you get through the 1.3 ride to the resort it is a good stay. I liked the area because you are away from Montego Bay. The beach and water are great and the pools are great as well. The food is average but there are a fair amount of choices. The staff however is top notch. In comparison to a trip to a Riu in Mexico the staff was amazing. Everyone is very friendly and helpful. I feel for the money it was a good deal. Try the boat ride to Ricks Cafe and snorkel trip this was a fun day. Also it seemed to rain every day around noon so it was the perfect time to grab some lunch because it alway cleared out by 1:00-1:30.

reviews.title: Nice, big, noisy
reviews.text: We stayed at the Riu Negril ClubHotel from 29Jan-12Feb 2009. We travel every year & this was our 2nd trip to Jamaica & also our 40th anniversary. We've seen a lot of places over the years & this is a fairly good one. It is a large property & a very nice resort that is designed with some thought with the residence buildings at one side & the bars, restaurants & entertainment on the other.

reviews.title: Disappointed....cannot and would not recommend...NOT GOING BACK!!!
reviews.text: We arrived at 5 past midnight & our check- in was chaotic. A line formed at the front desk but we were lucky to be 2nd. There was no welcome drink or prepared envelopes ready for us as there are for the day time arrivees. It was like we were not expected. We checked in & took our own luggage & followed the signs to our room.

reviews.title: Yearly trip of the growing OB nurses and doctors
reviews.text: The food is very good at all venues. The mandatory morning line-up to book your reservations is archaic & quite frankly the food does not justify the silly line-up.

Just returned from a week in sunny Jamaica and loved it just as much as the four other times I've been to Jamaica! My mom and I enjoyed a little girls getaway! Unsure about all the negative reviews, as we had a wonderful week… have stayed at other resorts in Jamaica but first time to Negril. I tried to break it down into categories:
reviews.title: Entertainment staff very very good, night and day!

reviews.text: Bus ride from airport: We got the shuttle through Tourwise when booking our trip. Bus driver didn't talk much... and there was no music. I was a little disappointed, but no big deal! Maybe he was having a bad day. About an hour trip to the resort from the airport. We stopped at a little local bar about halfway to get Red Stripes & use bathroom
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-In: Super fast and easy. We walked up, she asked if we would like a drink, we ordered two dirty bananas... she took our paperwork, our drinks were brought to us and then we had our keys and info shortly thereafter!
reviews.title: Every thing no problem mon!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: We were in the first building, which was closest to the lobby/restaurants. Just your typical hotel room... clean, boring, beds were decent, our maid was great, stocked bar & fridge. Only sleep/shower in there so it's not high on my priority list!! There isn’t much soundproofing so if you’re a light sleeper bring earplugs! Loved the fresh flowers they put in the bathrooms every day, nice little tropical touch! There's free wi-fi in the lobby which is in added bonus!
reviews.title: Loved it...

reviews.text: Pool/Beach: The pools were great, the resort wasn't super busy so there was never any issue finding chairs in a spot you wanted any time throughout the day. There was usually music playing at both which was nice. The ocean was gorgeous while we were there... even saw a few sting rays swim by one day!
reviews.title: Amazing!! Scared from reviews, They were 5000% wrong!

reviews.text: Like many on reading the reviews I was apprehensive to say the least about my stay at this hotel. As usual I should've trusted my judgement because it was fantastic. People expectations really are of the scale sometimes?!?!
reviews.title: Yeh mon!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are going to Jamaica for the first time then negril isn't right....only because it's too far away from the main attractions,mainly dunns river which was breathtaking and a must see.
reviews.title: great trip !!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that it was picture post card. I tend to agree with most re the beach at the hotel...it isn't the best but still beautiful. Get a taxi to margaritaville on 7 mile beach just down the road and it truly is amazing, White sands clear turquoise sea.
reviews.title: Relaxing and Restful Place

reviews.text: The hotel was imaculate and the staff where forever cleaning. As for the bugs....don't go to a tropical island if u want to avoid them.
reviews.title: Great Time. Not so great food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food, yes repetitive-but aren't all. You could make a meal every night. Fresh meat and fish cooked in front of you each night, salad, Jamaica corner with traditional cuisine, seafood,cheeses,potatoes,soups plus lots more. Unfortunatly I do not don't have all that choice in my kitchen so my family and I where more than happy. The only point to make is that they need more fruit,melon everynight is not good. How can you be on a tropical island an not have lots of different fruit on offer?!
reviews.title: Have fun...

reviews.text: We've just got back from a 2-week stay at the Riu ClubHotel. All in all it was fantastic. We flew with Lauda Air and the flight was good for the diet: they don't give you so much to eat so take a sandwich on board. The transfer to the hotel was 1 hour 15 mins, and when we arrived, the check-in was super-fast. We had requested a room in building 1 or 2, and we got a room in Building 2. I would recommend these buildings as they are closer to the restaurants and pools. The room did have a musty smell but it wasn't terrible and we soon got used to it. Our clothes all smell musty now though, due to the room smell and the general humidity in Jamaica. We had a king-size double bed, not 2 singles together as I had read in other reviews. The room had mosquito screens so we didn't have to use the plug-in repellent we had taken. All in all, it was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: A wonderful holiday.
Club Riu is The Bizness!
reviews.text: The food in the hotel was great! Lots of choice, and always fresh and tasty. The fruit was disappointing, particularly the melon which tasted of nothing, but the delicious pineapple made up for it. we ate at all the restaurants. Sir Andrew was great. (Again, there was a musty smell there too when we looked round by day, but fortunately it had disappeared by evening.) The service was very slow at Shadows restaurant, so I wasn't even hungry by the time my food arrived, which was a shame as it was delicious. We ate at the Brazilian restaurant, Luigi, which was ok but nothing exceptional. Watch out for the wine, particularly the white wine, as it's inbelievably bad! Jamaican beer is better, thank goodness... The Jerk Hut on the beach serves great jerk chicken at lunchtime.

reviews.title: Jamaica me happy!
reviews.text: The best thing about the hotel, in my view, was the entertainment. The entertainment team on the beach organised great daytime activities (Aqua gym, a crash-course in reggae dancing, volleyball and water-polo matches, etc.) They were really friendly and lots of fun. (Look out for Hot Dog and Rocky: they'll have you in stitches, and Nyanka is also very friendly). It's a great way to meet people (and win mini-bottles of rum!) The evening entertainment was also good, especially the steel band. Make sure you see them: they're excellent.

reviews.title: Be careful
reviews.text: The beach was clean although the water was not as clear as I had hoped. We often took a taxi from outside the hotel and went to Sun Beach, a bar on Long Bay, about 10 mins from the hotel. The taxi cost 5$ per person, there and back. It's well worth it: the sand is even softer and whiter than on Bloody Bay beaches, and the water is crystal-clear and turquoise. You don't need to pay to use the beach there but you do need to buy a drink at the bar. Believe me, it's worth it. On Sunday evenings, they have a special offer of a lobster supper on the beach, with a live reggae band. You pay $28 per couple. We didn't go there as we discovered it too late. Instead, we ate one evening at Conch Hill, another bar/restaurant on the beach of Long Bay. We ate pasta with lobster, and then a dish of mixed fish, including lobster. It cost $35 each for that meal (including wine - European, hooray!! - and a taxi to and from the hotel), and it was delicious.

If you go to Sun Beach, ask for Marsha, who has a hut next door where she gives wonderful massages using aloe gel. The hotel charges $50 for 30 minutes of massage; Marsha charges $30 for 45 minutes. She also braided my hair for $25. We also went on a jetski while there, which cost $35 for 30 minutes, compared with $40 for 15 minutes at the hotel. You get stunning sunsets from Sun Beach too, if you're lucky cloud-wise.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the RIU

reviews.text: This was my third time staying at ClubHotel Riu Negril. (Was there 05/11 and 08/11) and we had a blast as usual. This time we had a group of 11 of us total, friends and family.
reviews.title: Third time is still a charm

reviews.text: The main reason we keep going back is because we absolutely love the people who work there, they MAKE the hotel what it is! The entertainment staff, lifeguards and bartenders are all wonderful. I was a little disappointed in the restaurant staff this time, a good majority of them weren't their usual friendly selves, and almost acted as if your presence annoyed them.
reviews.title: Not Good for Kids

reviews.text: We had a few minor issues that were annoying, but nothing huge. The resort seemed to have a problem with towels and ice the week we were there. Neither could be found most of the time. They would run out of beach towels and give you bath towels instead (no big deal) but then you had a hard time getting bath towels in your room. And the restaurants kept running out of ice for drinks.
reviews.title: J-Anna

reviews.text: About half of our group had issues with their room safe getting stuck but a simple call to the front desk and the manager would come fix it.
reviews.title: Go here you'll be happy for sure, 3rd time in Jamaica.

reviews.text: We did the catamaran "booze cruise" to Rick's one afternoon (booked through the DJ with the scuba shop at the resort), which included stops for snorkeling as well as a trip to Rick's Cafe. IMO Rick's is a little overrated and touristy for my taste, but a few of us jumped and that made it fun - skipped the drinks/food (overpriced). The boat ride was a blast, full of rum punch good music and good company. We also stopped to snorkel for a bit on the way.
reviews.title: Great time in Jamaica

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a good time, the food was tasty, the room was cozy. We had so much fun we wished our visit was longer. We went down to Negril for the ATI weekend, hoping to attend all the Digicel parties and ended up missing most of them because of the amenities that were available.
reviews.title: It was O.K.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Riu from Apr 4-11. Both of us have travelled to many all inclusive resorts before - this was by far the best vacation we've ever had. First of all, we should let you know that we're pretty easy to please. There was NOTHING that we would've changed about this vacation. From check-in, to check out, the people at the Riu went out of their way to ensure we were taken care of. The food was amazing. Not once did we have a desire to book an a la carte as the buffetts were overwhelming with selection and taste!! The drinks were to die for - try a Chocolate Monkey, and if the pool bar isnt too busy, ask him to make you a bob marley shooter - delish!!!
reviews.title: Only One Complaint........The Week was over too quick!!! :)

reviews.text: We read the reviews on here before going and were a bit hesitant - however, we found like most reviews, the people that have time to take pics of moldy shower curtains or cracked tiles needed to get a life - or perhaps enter vacation mode.
reviews.title: Don't Go: Read Below

reviews.text: We will be back next year, no questions asked mon. I just hope the Jerk Natzi is still there serving up that delicious chicken!!!!
reviews.title: Lovely holiday would go back tomorrow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Any questions, please feel free to email us!
reviews.title: Can't wait to come back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the RIU 2/9-2/16/09 and can't say enough good about this place. I had read some of the reviews and simply cannot understand how picky and negative some people are. This was our 6th all inclusive, 4 in Mexico and one other in Ocho Rios and found this to be one of the best.
reviews.title: Wonderful bit of heaven

reviews.text: We are total beach bums and were happy so see how great the beach area is. I like partial shade and my husband loves the sun and with all the palm trees, neither one of us had any problem. The water is a little murky but I don't see how that could be helped with the waves crashing against the beach constantly. We loved having a bar on the beach and the jerk hut was wonderful. The little Reggae band and the Cigarette man on the beach really added to the unique Jamaican experience.
reviews.title: Great Beach!

reviews.text: Our room was very nice. No problems with the AC or hot water. We didn't get new wash clothes each day but used the hand towels. No problem mon, we were in Jamaica! We did however get plenty of new towels which kind of confused us because on the bathroom counter there is a sign asking you to hang up your towel if you choose to "recycle" and use it again to conserve energy. We did that each day but they were always gone and replaced with new ones. (Why put the sign out?) We were in the 4th building and yes it was quite a ways from the main part of the resort but that was the only exercise we got except for getting us off our loungers to get another drink so it was good for us!
reviews.title: Do not stay here! It is not safe!

reviews.text: The food there was absolutely fantastic. The selection at the buffet was endless and everything we ate (my husband is very picky) was fabulous. The standing in line for the ala carte restaurants is a joke. We learned quickly the first day after my husband stood in line for an hour that it wasn't worth the wait when the buffet is so good. We ate at the steakhouse and found the food to be okay but definitely not any better than the buffet food and NOT worth the wait in line.
reviews.title: So much better than we thought it would be!

reviews.text: The entertainment staff here is outstanding. They work so hard and such long hours to make your vacation fun and enjoyable. They are very talented to be able to present such a wide variety of shows each evening and deserve all the compliments and praise they can get. The service staff is also very dedicated to making your vacation memorable. None of these people make much money at all and truly appreciate your respect and $1 tip for their hard work.
reviews.title: Wonderful Wedding and Honeymoon!!!

reviews.text: Arrived in Jamaica on Sat. had a good week up until Thurs. morning when I talked to my daughter and husband at breakfast. Their room was broken into while they were asleep. My daught woke up to a Jamacian in their room. Thank the Lord they were not hurt and that they only stole their camera. My thing is though the Riu did not compt them on anything not money for their loss or a free week at another Riu. We had a large group of family and friends go to Jamaica 17 of us. After that happen to them none of us could really sleep at night. The security need to be better would never go back there.
reviews.title: Room broken into to at night while sleeping

reviews.text: This was our second time to the Club Hotel and I would say it was as good if not better than the first. Very few people this time around which made finding a seat poolside very easy as well as meals in the buffet restaurants, always empty tables!! Rooms are of adequate size and just fine but I do agree with other posters that the beds are not very comfortable.
reviews.title: Same as the last time, Very Good Stay

reviews.text: Beach - Very good, not sure why people complain
reviews.title: absolutely amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food - Very good but I do agree about the reservation system as well as the weddings. They need to have a banquette facility for these weddings.
reviews.title: Bang Bong!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pools - OK, I would like bigger pools though
reviews.title: Lots of other resorts out there which are better and cheaper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived to a room that felt like a sauna, both hot humid and smelled of mildew probably since the matress boxspring had mold on it. After asking for the AC to be looked, at they said they fixed it but didn't feel much of a change. A day later, we asked for it to be looked at again, and they said it worked "fine." I wasn't looking for a cold room, just someting a little less humid. The temp. was much nicer outside but didn't want to keep the balcony door open all the time. That was it for me, I asked our Apple rep. if we could pay extra and move to another resort in Negril. She inquired and we were moved to the RIU Palace Tropical Bay on day #3 free of charge. We talked to others at the resort and they complained of the same problem. They too were waiting to switch rooms only to find out the AC didn't work there either. We came across a couple who had money taken from their safe while they slept because they left their balcony door open due to lack of AC....and this was on the second floor!!
reviews.title: Not Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didn't try the "gourmet" resturants because I didn't want to wait in line over an hour in the am for the reservation. Buffets were typical AI fare, maybe slightly less to choose from compared to other places we've visited but not terrible--always something to eat. I recommend going off the resort to eat at the Rockhouse for an awesome atmosphere and great food!!
reviews.title: our experience was very enjoyable

reviews.text: If you plan to do any kind of exercise like I usually do a litlle on vacation, don't plan on doing it in what they call a "fitness center"---it was a joke.
reviews.title: Just ok - Some good, some bad!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've had positive experiences at other AIs including Iberostar, Gran Bahia Principe and Palace Resorts but this will be the first and last time I visit a RIU. Maybe it was just the RIUs in Jamaica??
reviews.title: front desk and management rude not helpful if you have a problem

reviews.text: Here were the positives:
reviews.title: I would stay here again

reviews.text: My sister was married here in June 2011 and a large group of us stayed here. It is all-inclusive with a great swim up bar and some interesting shows at night. The beach is okay - lots of seaweed in the water which grosses me out. Bring a big plastic cup so you don't need to keep finding a bar for refills! Staff was friendly and rooms were nice. We all had a great time!
reviews.title: Great time!

reviews.text: I do not have much to add here but please beware that smoking is allowed in the rooms and you might be disappointed as we were that someone smoked cigars and this room was the only adjoining room available the first night. The hotel moved us the 2nd day but keep this in mind.
reviews.title: Just back from the Riu Negril

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar was a disappointment as I expected the RIU to be much like the RIU Santa Fe in Los Cabos with better liquor. This was a real dissapointment as rum is not what I want to drink on vacation.
reviews.title: I have been to both Riu in Negril several times!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pluses and there were many:
reviews.title: The RIU Negril is an average all inclusive resort w/great service...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) Try to make as many reservations at the Gourmet restaurant - the best of the bunch
reviews.title: The Honest truth in my opinion

reviews.text: Just got back yesterday and have to say the place was just fine. Not a five star but no where near all the bad rap it was getting.
reviews.title: No Problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were fine, a/c worked, hot water and great maid service.
reviews.title: a nice time overall, but would not stay again

reviews.text: Grounds are wonderful, beach is big and plenty of room and chairs. Pool areas are nice, never over crowded either. Swim-up bar is nice, but could use another bartender at times. Went to the bar above most times to get quicker service. Speaking of bars, there are plenty to be found. Spent most of our time on the beach. Water is fine and plenty of beach to walk. As usual the venders along the way are interesting and believe it or not we got some rings for free from the Rastaman along the way. He then made another item for us that we tipped him for. Very, very interesting conversation with him. But like always, respect.
reviews.title: Great family vacation.

reviews.text: Food was good, I would not say great. Had better buffets at other resorts but it was fine. Shadows Steak House was good as well as Luigis (liked this one the best, with the shaved meats), Sir Andrews was o.k. The jerk chicken here is overated. I would call it family freindly. Go to town and enjoy some jerk.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Entertainment crew is pretty good, always doing something throughout the day. Are not pushy either, if you want to participate go ahead if not sit back and relax. Shows are above average.
reviews.title: Competely Satisfied

reviews.text: I just came back from this resort being there for a week of April 20-28. All I can say is that I can only agree with the negative reviews. Rooms are not prepared for the guests, no towels, no shampoo, no conditioner, light in the room entrance is broken, light in the bathroom flickering, no garbage bin in the bathroom, barely flashing toilette... When towels finally arrive they are disgusting brown color and with holes. I could not even touch my face with this towel. Beds are even worse. I opened the cover and first that I saw was a long black hair on a pillow case that was all spotted. I left a 5 dollars tip the next day and asked to change the pillow cases that never arrived.
reviews.title: Mosquitos paradise, 2 star hotel

reviews.text: My child had a diarrea there and saturated the sheet.. It took 3 (three) hours for someone to come in and change the sheet during the day. I imagine how great that would be in the middle of the night.
reviews.title: Horrible. Dirty. Worst hotel ever.

reviews.text: Most importantly, if you don't like insect bites (mosquitos or whatever other insects that left 20 bites on my legs), dont dare to go to this resort. They are aware of this though and nicely selling cortisone in a gift shop (so pack your shamppoo and conditioner, not cortisone, because they have it).
reviews.title: Riu Club Negril - No Problems!!!

reviews.text: The only 2 things about this resort: food was decent and water in the bay is amazing.
reviews.title: The Longer I Was There, The More I Wanted to Leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I hope this review helps someone who considers going to this resort trying to save the money as I did. just NOT WORTH it.
reviews.title: Going Back 2nd time in June 2011 Really Enjoyed ourselves here....
A Tropical Dream Come True
reviews.text: Just returned from a wonderful week at Hotel Riu Negril with my teenage son and daughter. I'd researched the trip vigorously; many reviews, good and bad, were accurate. Honestly, my rating hovers between 'above average' and 'excellent'.

reviews.title: Great hotel but the bugs killed the trip
reviews.text: The grounds, buildings and entire setting are spectacular: with lush gardens, sculptures, sprawling classical architecture, two pools (one with a bar, another with a waterfall), and a series of open-air and closed restaurants, bars, and auditorium - under the (mostly) bright blue tropical sky, extending to the lapping shore of Bloody Bay.

Along a path from the lobby, four lavender buildings house guestrooms, all of which provide ocean views. Though our 'summer sale/garden view' room was small, the balcony did overlook a splendid garden, with the sea looming beyond. Since the resort is young (one and a half yrs), the ceramic tile and stucco still gleam. Our lemon yellow room smelled of mildew, but the air conditioner worked well and the shower was fantastic.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
two europeans say "never again"!
reviews.text: The abundant staff is kind and hard-working. I'd brought dollar bills, for tips, but I seemed the only one handing them out (especially at meals), so I kept them for housekeeping.

reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday
reviews.text: English was the primary language, but the guests were mostly European. Though the atmosphere was respectful, other guests didn't make eye contact or smile. There were topless (female) sunbathers (an eye-opener for my kids), but the resort definitely had a family feeling. I enjoyed the international experience very much.

Just got back from Riu Negril from July 9 to July 13. Its a really beautiful resort....great atmosphere, comfortable, friendly customer service the moment you arrive (as soon as we reached the reception area, we were given a really delicious fruit punch drink). Your made to feel right at home. Check in was really easy. While being escorted to our rooms (which unfortunately was in building #3, which is a pretty good walk away from the other activities of the hotel....see if you could get into buildings #1 or #2, unless of course you don't mind being away from the activities and the noise that could come with it), you couldn't help but admire the beauty of the resort, and the groundskeepers do a great job of keeping the gardens IMMACULATE! Our hotel room was gorgeous and cool (the air conditioner was already on when we arrived). The beds are very firm and comfortable, the closets are huge, the bathroom was decent, and we had a balcony and could see the wonderful garden and even had a great side view of the seven mile beach and the ocean. Gorgeous!!
reviews.title: ClubHotel Riu Negril....Great, but need improvements!!
i love RIU Negril
reviews.text: NOW LETS TALK ABOUT THE FOOD, HONEY!! Oh my gosh, unless you have self control, YOU WILL GAIN WEIGHT!!!! For breakfast at the Green Island (and I must say this place is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED), you have everything you could possibly think of to eat, and plenty of it!! From pancakes to ackee & saltfish....all is yours for the taking and as often as you want. A great variety of food. Its the same for lunch and for dinner (especially dinner!!). Mostly everything I've eaten tasted oh sooooo good!! You have a choice of going to the other restaurants on the resort as well (such as Sir Andrew or Steakhouse Shadows or Luigi), but we never got around to those restaurants since you have to make a reservation for them early. But Green Island was more than sufficient. I don't see why you would need to go anywhere else, in my opinion!

reviews.title: Love The Trip
reviews.text: The beach was, well, ok, but I personally didn't care for it. The sand wasn't nearly as pretty and clean as when I went to Maui (where the sands are so powderly and white and pink). Unfortunately, we arrived at the resort right after Hurricane Dennis became a menace and pulverized Jamaica (which was a reason we were advised by customer service that it may not be a good idea to swim in the ocean due to algae in the sea). So I'll be fair....perhaps the beach wasn't so particularly nice because of the storm.

reviews.title: Nice getaway
reviews.text: NOW, A WORD TO THE WISE......IF YOU ARE ARRIVING FOR JAMAICA AROUND THIS TIME, PLEASE BRING WITH YOU "OFF" INSECT REPELLANT!!! I can't stress this enough!! Believe me, YOU WILL GET TARGETED BY THE MOSQUITOES, and they are not shy about making themselves known to you in a very intimate manner!! Your insect repellant will be your best friend! I advise you, it is far better to go to the carribean in the winter than in the summer. I learned that the hard and itchy way!!

reviews.title: Beautiful resort, but could improve on Customer Service
reviews.text: Some things that need to be improved upon is each hotel room should have its own iron! Unfortunately, at this resort, you have to call customer service and put up $10.00 for security purposed to get an iron which you are allowed to use for three hours otherwise you lose your $10.00. The entertainment at this resort could be improved upon. Its not that great, and could be a real yawn. They could be a bit skimpy with the bath towels and washcloths, (especially the washcloths, so you may want to bring your own just in case). Also, I feel for a resort that is so established as RIU, they should have their own shuttle service to take you to and from the hotel. We had to rely on Jamaica Tours, which did not arrive at a timely manner at all (it arrived an hour late to pick us up from the hotel to take us to the airport in Montego Bay, which is about 1 hour and a half away. Very poor service).
My 5th time in JA 2nd time at The Riu Club
reviews.title: No Worries Mon!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-In...Was smooth cocktails while we checked in we had rooms in bldg. 3 which is a nice long walk to the rest of the resort so we requested Bldg. 1 and it was granted the next day no problem.
reviews.title: Everyt'ing was irie 'mon! A+

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room...Was clean spacious for 3 ladies in a room we didnt seem to bump into each other durin our stay, the bathroom was clean with double sinks which was perfecr for 3 ladies in a room...big closet, huge floor to ceiling mirror, big closet and stocked bar always a plus! the only thing the room was missing was a coffee maker (no big deal) as I had a hang ova every morning lol...but my lovely roommate would bring a pot of fresh brewed coffee from the breakfast area to our room...thank goodness for her!!
reviews.title: Nice Place, great time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food...My favorite meal was the breakfast buffet the dinner was good tooand the variety is endless even the pickiest eater wont starve. We ate at Luigi restaurant our last night it was nice but probably would have been fine dining at the buffet.
reviews.title: It Was OK, I guess

reviews.text: Beach...I cant say much about the beach I did lounge on the beach but I'm not a beach person although the water was calm and clear it's just not my thing. The pools was lovely especially the pool bar with music and drinks flowing good times!
reviews.title: Very nice vacation
Never again.......
reviews.text: Okay, we booked a trip on Saturday leaving the following Wednesday. Choices were limited, pictures and so on about the Riu Negril were Ok. After all, what could be so bad with a resort that was a year old? I've been to Negril several times and never had what I would call a bad stay.

reviews.title: Totally disappointed Riu Negril
reviews.text: We arrived by private car at about 2 PM. No crowds, 100 person groups checking in and so on. Mass confusion with our reservation. We booked (and paid for IN ADVANCE) oceanfront room. After extended discussion, put mildly, we got our oceanfront room. The facility and property are beautiful, 4 stars. It went downhill after the shine wore off.

reviews.title: Don't Go There
reviews.text: 1st: Food and Beverage

All of the beer and liquor are domestic, which is ok if you like rum. Ever try Jamacian Vodka or Bourbon? Don't. There are never enough bartenders to serve the crowd at the bar. I guess this is managements' way of controlling liquor cost. Make them wait 20 minutes for a drink.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Not so Good

reviews.text: There are 3 sitdown restaurants and a large buffet. The buffet is great for breakfast. After that, forget it. I'm trying not to trash the place, but the food was terrible. You need reservations to eat dinner in the sitdown restaurants. This part blew me away. You have a 30 minute window (10:30 AM - 11:00 AM) when there is a table set up in the main lobby taking reservations for dinner that day only. You can't phone in, must come in person. If you miss that 30 min time in the middle of the day, you are out of luck. Eat at the trough, I mean the buffet. We managed to have dinner at the Shadows Steakhouse (remember 'Steakhouse') on night. They had a ribeye on the menu, but were out of them. I ordered the mixed grill. It was ok, nothing to write home about.
reviews.title: Would Return Again

reviews.text: Was completely disappointed in this hotel. Pretty on outside but not worth it. A waste of money. Food was decent but limited, bar service and alcohol choices very limited. Not really what I would call an all inclusive resort. So many added charges. And rooms never cleaned well
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Riu Negril June 23 - 30 and had an awesome time. This is our 3rd time there and we will definately go back. Room, food, and service were all great. We loved the jerk chicken on the beach. We have tried Ocho Rios and Runaway Bay but loke the beaches in Negril best.
reviews.title: Another Great Visit

reviews.text: I stayed at the ClubHotel Riu Negril from May 23-27, 2012. The staff at the hotel were wonderful... front desk, bars, restaurants, maids. I definitely have no complaints whatsoever and they went out of their way to may sure guests were happy. The location of the hotel was great as it was close to The Jungle and Margaritaville and it was safe. Great variety of food at the buffet, there truly was something for everyone. I understand what other reviewers said about the a la carte restaurants. We personally didn't have a problem getting a reservation any night and the food was fantastic.
reviews.title: You can't have a bad time in JA!

reviews.text: The over all resort itself was small compared to others I've stayed at in MoBay and the pool was really tiny and a bit cloudy. Spent most of our time at the beach and it was great.
reviews.title: Great family resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I probably wouldn't return to this resort but I didn't have a bad time and really... can you have a bad time in JA?!
reviews.title: AN EXCELLENT ALL INCLUSIVE HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have to write review to make up for all the trash people have been putting up here. I just got back with my wife and another couple. We have nothing to complain about. The place is beautiful, the food is decent (especially the jerk chicken).
reviews.title: Reviews are hilarious!! Riu was such a great place!!

reviews.text: The staff are super friendly and nice. I will admit the entertainment was so bad but I don't go for that however some of you might. The drinks are watered down but I'm convinced its for the better because it is so hot there some times and dehydration would suck.
reviews.title: You get what you give

reviews.text: Rooms were clean and fine, maids are best to tip for a consistently well kept room with a fully stocked fridge.
reviews.title: dont stay here

reviews.text: The beach was so amazing, shallow clean water, I'll miss that. The pool bar is fun too. Anyways, bring a good attitude, it's gonna be Iiiiiryyy, Ya Mon.
reviews.title: Best two days ever!!

reviews.text: If you think you're worth 5 stars and want that kind of service its called tipping!!
reviews.title: Very good -don't listen to the moaners

description: * Located on Jamaica's west coast in Negril * Located on the beach front * Complimentary sun loungers on the beach * Main building and four 2-story annexes * Surrounded by 45,000 m2 / 56,000 sq. yards of lush gardens * 9 km / 5.5 miles from Negril's West End * 7 km / 4.4 miles from various shops * 80 km / 48 miles from Montego Bay airport * Credit cards accepted: MasterCard, Amex, Visa, Diners
